item.title: Better DOM Morphing with Morphlex
Nilo Stolte Graphics - Vector Graphics UI/GUI
item.description: Is your app prepared for tomorrow's resolutions? We offer services and promote vector graphics primitives for the development of interfaces (UI, GUI) on desktops, mobile, web, and embedded systems. The objective is better portability across different platforms and languages, as well as a better solution for different displays resolutions.

item.title: An Idea to Not Get Phished
item.description: Anyone who is remotely tech savvy doesn't need Google to tell them 'Phishing is one of the top ways bad actors intrude and steal data.' We recently witnessed a phishing attack on the npm supply chain. Luckily it was caught before having major repercussions. But it got me thinking: what steps can we take to prevent it from happening again? Or at least reduce the probability. I filed away the thought at the time.

item.title: Using CRDTs + Sync as a Database
item.description: Can you use a CRDT as a Database? I’ve been thinking about this a lot, and my answer is a resounding… Maybe Depends on your data, and your use case. If your data is a good fit, and you’re ready to take on the quirks associated with doing so, I’m working on a batteries-included, decentralized DB that will store/track history/sync/query/authenticate/encrypt for you. Choose Eidetica as your database, and get all of that for free.
